alert.note: Alert for Bleckley; Pulaski (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 6:16AM EDT until April 03 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River at Abbeville affecting Wilcox, Dodge and Telfair Counties. Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville affecting Pulaski and Bleckley Counties. Oconee River near Mount Vernon affecting Wheeler, Treutlen and Montgomery Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Abbeville, Hawkinsville... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Mount Vernon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.5 feet, Minor flooding of roads continues on the southside of Hawkinsville...along Gooseneck Lane. Water continues to inundate Gooseneck Lane, cutting off access to homes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM EDT Monday the stage was 20.3 feet and slowly falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 11.7 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 20 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
